name: emojic
description: Emoji in your Node.js command line apps.
author: Ionică Bizău <bizauionica@gmail.com> (http://ionicabizau.net)

blah.description: In the screenshot below I'm using a Linux terminal emulator which doesn't support *colorful* emoji (in the way like OS X does).
blah.thanks: Thanks to [**@muan**](https://github.com/muan) for creating the [`emojilib`](https://github.com/muan/emojilib) project we use here. :sparkles:
documentation: Require the library using `var emojic = require("emojic")`. Then you can use the camel case notation for the emoji names (like in the example). Visit [emoji.muan.co](http://emoji.muan.co) to search the icons.
For example, if you want to display in console `:heart_eyes:` (:heart_eyes:), you will use `console.log(emojic.heartEyes)` (notice the camelCaseStyle)
